title: 104_hr3665
content: The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" is cited as the short title. The authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture is transferred to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Census of Agriculture Act of 1996 transferred the authority to conduct a census of agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. Section 526 of the Revised Statutes was amended to require the Secretary to conduct a census in 1998 and every 5th year thereafter, using surveys, data collection, and statistical methods as needed. Data collected in each census relates to the previous year. Refusal to answer questions is prohibited. The census data relates to the year before it is taken. Refusal to answer census questions or providing false information is subject to penalties under the United States Code. Failure to disclose a social security number upon request is also addressed. Each census under this subsection shall include each State, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, as well as other areas under US jurisdiction. Failure to disclose a social security number in response to a census request is not a violation. The Secretary of Commerce can provide information collected under title 13, United States Code to the Secretary of Agriculture for census or survey purposes. This information can only be used for statistical purposes. The Secretary of Agriculture will provide information collected in a census under this subsection to the Secretary of Commerce for census or survey purposes. The information can only be used for statistical purposes. Rules and regulations for this subsection can be prescribed by appropriate authorities. The Secretary of Agriculture will provide census information to the Secretary of Commerce for statistical purposes only. Rules and regulations for this subsection can be prescribed by the respective authorities. Section 142 of title 13, United States Code, and related items are repealed effective October 1, 1998. Section 142 of title 13, United States Code, and related items are repealed. Section 343(a)(11)(F) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CONFIDENTIALITY OF INFORMATION. The text discusses amending sections of the United States Code related to furnishing information to the Department of Agriculture and Department of Commerce, specifically regarding confidentiality of information. The text amends sections of the United States Code related to furnishing information to the Department of Commerce, specifically addressing confidentiality of information under section 526(c)(6) of the Revised Statutes. The text amends confidentiality provisions under section 526(c)(6) of the Revised Statutes, treating the information as if it were furnished under title 13 of the United States Code. The House of Representatives passed the bill on July 22, 1996. Attest: ROBIN H. CARLE, Clerk.
